title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section

8(1A)) (Transfer of Departmental Records) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited national archive act 1986 (section 8(1a)) (transfer departmental records) order 2023

title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 January 2024.
text_raw: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 January 2024.

title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30
text_raw:
3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30
years old but more than 20 years old, namely Anglo Irish records relating to the 
peace process and Northern Ireland, including Departmental records relating to 
the Good Friday Agreement, for the period from 1 January 2003 to 31 
December 2003, that are held by the Department of the Taoiseach, shall be 
transferred, in accordance with the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 
1986), to the National Archives. 

The Taoiseach consents to the making of the foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Taoiseach, 

22 November, 2023. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Taoiseach. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th December, 2023. 

 The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the making of the foregoing Order. 

[607] 3

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform, 

23 November, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 December, 2023. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and 
Media. 

 4 [607]
